meanings.definition: A group of young people who frequent the yards of houses or other buildings.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood kids formed a gang of yardbirds who played in everyone's yards.
meanings.sent2: The yardbirds often gathered in the park to hang out and chat.
meanings.sent3: The yardbirds decided to have a race to see who could run the fastest around the block.
meanings.sent4: The yardbirds flocked together like a colorful bunch of birds in the yard.
meanings.sent5: The image of the yardbirds laughing and playing in the yard stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or unskilled in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: As a yardbird in the kitchen, she often burned the toast and overcooked the eggs.
meanings.sent2: The new intern was a yardbird when it came to using the company's software.
meanings.sent3: He felt like a yardbird trying to fix the broken bike without any tools.
meanings.sent4: She was a yardbird in the art class, struggling to paint within the lines.
meanings.sent5: The yardbird driver nervously stalled the car multiple times during the driving lesson.

meanings.definition: A term used to refer to chickens or other domestic fowl kept in a yard.
meanings.sent1: The farmer raised a flock of yardbirds for fresh eggs every morning.
meanings.sent2: The yardbirds clucked happily as they pecked at the grains in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to sneak up on the yardbirds but got scared away by their squawks.
meanings.sent4: The yardbirds strutted around the yard as if they owned the place.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the colorful yardbirds roaming freely in the yard was a peaceful one.
